subsection_analysis.refined_text:
For HR professionals seeking to create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and completing paperwork, this summary only includes the essential details:

1. E-Sign: Open PDF forms in Acrobat and select the All toolsFill & Sign global bar. Alternatively, select > .
2. Fill & Sign tools displayed in left panes. Fill in form fields and sign using sign tools described below.

1. Choose an Adobe PDFBatch Conversion tool, specify your preferred layers, page size, plot style, and output PDFs.
2. In the DWG List, choose any of the following options:

For HR professionals who wish to create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance in Acrobat and Acrobat Reader, turn off the generative AI features only when necessary for better productivity. You can contact Adobe Customer Care to revoke access if necessary for your team or organization.

The page numbers on the document pages don't always match the page numbers that appear below the page thumbnails and in the right toolbar. This is caused by the PDF containing front matter, which may not follow the numbering shown in the right toolbar. To specify various numbering styles for a group of pages or add new page numbers to an existing one, use the "Page Labels" tool provided by the PDF software. You can also customize the numbering system using a prefix, such as Chapter 1 that allows you to assign numbers from 1-1, 1-2, etc., for Chapter 1. However, these specifications may not apply to all PDF documents and require further investigation.

The given text is aimed at HR professionals who want to Create and manage fillable forms for onboarding and compliance.
